info.title: Event Reporting API
info.description:
Use this API to report cancellation and delay events, as well as other SLA
breaches, directly to Ruter, along with a flag indicating whether you as an
operator consider that the event was outside your control, and that you should
be exempt from being fined for incurred/reported SLA breach(es).

post.description: Report a cancellation or delay event.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description:
OAuth2 access token as Bearer token.

**NOTE:** Separate documentation will be provided on how to obtain client
credentials and use these to request access tokens.

201.description:
The traffic event was registered.

The response contains a single traffic event for the given journey if the
registration provided a `journeyRef`. If the registration provided a `lineRef`
and a time interval, the response contains one traffic event for each journey
that took place on the given line in the given time period.

400.description: One or more invalid input parameters (e.g., invalid `category`)

403.description: Invalid access token or insufficient access for operation

post.description:
Report an SLA breach directly to Ruter, along with a flag indicating whether you as an
operator consider that the breach was outside your control, and that you should be
exempt from being fined for the breach.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description:
OAuth2 access token as Bearer token.

**NOTE:** Separate documentation will be provided on how to obtain client
credentials and use these to request access tokens.

400.description: One or more invalid input parameters (e.g., invalid `category`)

403.description: Invalid access token or insufficient access for operation

id.description: The traffic event ID. Format: <registration-ID>-<sequence number>

registrationId.description: The ID of the traffic event registration that was submitted for this traffic event.

status.description: The status of the traffic event.

trafficCaseNumber.description:
The traffic case number of the Ruterlogg traffic case that was created from the
traffic event registration submitted for this traffic event.

category.description: The main category of the traffic event.

subcategory.description: The subcategory of the traffic event.

reasonCategory.description:
The reason category of the traffic event. Inferred from `category`, `subcategory` and
`reason`.

reasonSubcategory.description:
The reason subcategory of the traffic event. Inferred from `category`, `subcategory`
and `reason`.

reason.description: The reason for the traffic event.

reasonDescription.description: If needed, a further detailing of the reason for the traffic event.

journeyRef.description: A reference to the planned journey that is affected by this traffic event.

lineRef.description: A reference to the line that the journey is serving.

vehicleTaskId.description: The ID of the vehicle task that the journey was part of.

startDateTime.description: An ISO UTC date string representing the date and time that the traffic event started.

endDateTime.description: An ISO UTC date string representing the date and time that the traffic event ended.

affectedQuayRefs.description:
If `category` is `CANCELLATION`: A list wth references to the quays affected by
the partial cancellation.

`null` otherwise.

delayMinutes.description:
If `category` is `DELAY`: The number of minutes that the journey is delayed.

`null` otherwise.

isOperatorExempt.description:
A flag indicating whether you as an operator should be exempt from being fined for any
SLA breach(es) incurred as a consequence of this traffic event.

registeredBy.description: Your operator's client identifier, automatically inferred from your API credentials.

registeredAt.description: The date and time that the traffic event was registered, in ISO UTC format.

category.description: The main category of the traffic event.

subcategory.description:
The subcategory of the traffic event.

Permitted values if `category` is `CANCELLATION`:
- `FULL`
- `PARTIAL`

Permitted values if `category` is `DELAY`:
- `FROM_START`
- `IN_TRANSIT`

reason.description:
The reason for the traffic event. If set to `OTHER`, a description must be provided in
the `reasonDescription` field.

reasonDescription.description:
Required if `reason` is set to `OTHER`, optional otherwise. A further detailing of the
reason for the traffic event, and if relevant, an explanation for why you as an
operator should be exempt from being fined for any SLA breach(es) incurred as a
consequence of this traffic event (see `isOperatorExempt`).

journeyRef.description:
Required if `lineRef` is `null`. A reference to the planned journey that is affected
by this traffic event, if only a single journey is affected.

Format should be one of:
- `RUT:DatedServiceJourney:<dated journey ID from plan data>`
- `RUT:DatedServiceJourney:<vehicle task ID>-<journey start time in ISO offset format>`

lineRef.description:
Required if `journeyRef` is `null`, ignored otherwise. A reference to the affected
line when multiple journeys are affected by this traffic event.

startDateTime.description:
Required if `journeyRef` is `null`, optional otherwise. An ISO UTC date string
representing the date and time that the traffic event started. If `null`, the start
time of the journey represented by `journeyRef` is used instead.

endDateTime.description:
Required if `journeyRef` is `null`, optional otherwise. An ISO UTC date string
representing the date and time that the traffic event ended. If `null`, the end time
of the journey represented by `journeyRef`, plus `delayMinutes` if given, is used
instead.

leftCancelledStopPlaceRef.description:
Required if `category` is `CANCELLATION` and `subcategory` is `PARTIAL`, ignored
otherwise. An NSR reference to one of the 2 stop places delimiting the sequence of
stops affected by the partial cancellation, or to the single stop if only one stop is
affected. See `rightStopPlaceRef`.

rightCancelledStopPlaceRef.description:
Required if `category` is `CANCELLATION` and `subcategory` is `PARTIAL`, ignored
otherwise. An NSR reference to the other of the 2 stop places delimiting the sequence
of stops affected by the partial cancellation, or to the single stop if only one stop
is affected. See `leftStopPlaceRef`.

delayMinutes.description:
Required if `category` is `DELAY`, ignored otherwise. The number of minutes that the
journey is delayed.

isOperatorExempt.description:
A flag indicating whether you as an operator consider that the event was outside your
control, and that you should be exempt from being fined for any SLA breach(es)
incurred as a consequence of the traffic event. If needed, an exemption reason can be
provided in the `reasonDescription` field.

id.description: The SLA breach ID. Must be `null` on registration.

trafficCaseNumber.description:
The traffic case number of the Ruterlogg traffic case that was created to log this SLA
breach. Must be `null` on registration.

reason.description: The reason for the SLA breach.

reasonDescription.description:
Required if `reason` is `OTHER`, optional otherwise. A further detailing of the reason
for the SLA breach, and if relevant, an explanation for why you as an operator should
be exempt from being fined for this breach.

contractRef.description: A reference to the contract that governs the SLA that was breached.

startDateTime.description: An ISO UTC date string representing the date and time that the SLA breach started.

endDateTime.description: An ISO UTC date string representing the date and time that the SLA breach ended.

isOperatorExempt.description:
A flag flag indicating whether you as an operator consider that the breach was outside
your control, and that you should be exempt from being fined for the breach.

registeredBy.description:
Your operator's client identifier, automatically inferred from your API credentials.
Must be `null` on registration.

registeredAt.description:
The date and time that the traffic event was registered, in ISO UTC format. Must be
`null` on registration.
